executive_summary: The Adhesive Manufacturing industry has undergone significant fluctuations over the last few years, largely influenced by the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. The global crisis led to reduced industrial activities, resulting in dampened adhesive manufacturing revenues and profits in 2020. However, the following year saw a surge in manufacturers' inventory buildup, in response to economic uncertainty that had been spurred by high inflation and disruptions in the supply chain. This adjustment in the broader manufacturing sector contributed to double-digit growth within this industry in 2021. Robust expansion in residential construction, which benefited from historically low mortgage rates at the time, further buoyed growth.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Pandemic Heightened Volatility in the Adhesives Manufacturing Industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Demand for adhesives experienced a sharp decline in 2020, mainly due to disruptions in the supply chain and a slowdown in nonresidential construction activities but also because of lower manufacturing volumes. As industrial sector businesses worked to navigate the evolving macroeconomic conditions by increasing their inventories, there was a notable uptick in demand for adhesives in 2021.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Relatively Flat Revenue Growth Projected for 2024 Due to Soft Demand in Manufacturing
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Although the Federal Reserve is expected to initiate interest rate cuts sometime in 2024, interest rates are expected to remain elevated at least until 2025, limiting economic growth. Major industry players remain cautious about their growth prospects in 2024, citing expectations of subdued economic expansion and sluggish manufacturing activity, which support muted growth in 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Industry's Global Trade Has Been Impacted by a Mix of Geopolitical and Economic Factors
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Following the implementation of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) on July 1, 2020 – which replaced NAFTA – the value of imported adhesives from Canada and Mexico increased, contributing to strong growth in imports. Nevertheless, the industry has experienced a decrease in exports to China, stemming from the trade tensions between the two nations ongoing since 2019 along with the strengthening of the US dollar in recent years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: THE ECONOMY IS EXPECTED TO NORMALIZE BY 2025, CONTRIBUTING TO STABLE INDUSTRY GROWTH
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Though interest rates are expected to remain elevated in 2024 until the rate cuts projected for later in the year occur, interest rates are anticipated to go down incrementally in 2025, further facilitating economic expansion. With economic growth, demand for adhesives across economic sectors will rise, contributing to stable growth for the Adhesive Manufacturing industry.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: DEVELOPMENTS IN THE BROADER MANUFACTURING AND CONSTRUCTION SECTORS WILL DETERMINE FUTURE GROWTH
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Soft demand is expected to result in declining manufacturing inventories in 2024, followed by a subsequent rebound in 2025. As manufacturers build up their inventories in response to normalized economic conditions, demand for adhesives will grow in 2025. Adhesives manufacturers will benefit from growth in residential and nonresidential construction.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: EXPANSION INTO FOREIGN MARKETS WILL FACILITATE INDUSTRY GROWTH
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The trade agreement signed between the US, Mexico and Canada (USMCA, replacing NAFTA) will continue to benefit domestic adhesive manufacturers by providing attractive opportunities to sell their products internationally. Additionally, IBISWorld anticipates the trade-weighted index – which measures the strength of the US dollar – will decline through 2029, making US-manufactured goods relatively less expensive for other countries.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: ADHESIVES MANUFACTURERS TO BENEFIT FROM TECHNOLOGICAL ADVANCEMENTS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Advances in technology will provide adhesive manufacturers with opportunities for product enhancement and process improvement, such as the development of adhesives with performance and reduced environmental impact. Given the ongoing challenges related to finding and retaining talent in the overall manufacturing sector, adhesive manufacturers will invest in robotics and artificial intelligence to streamline processes and reduce production errors.

industry_definition: The Adhesive Manufacturing industry produces a wide range of products used in various sectors like construction, automotive and consumer goods. The adhesives provide bonding solutions for diverse materials, including metals, plastics and wood. Adhesives are also vital in the production of semiconductors and other technologies. The industry encompasses manufacturers of both synthetic and natural adhesives. Industry products serve as crucial components in facilitating assembly, repair and maintenance across numerous applications, contributing to the efficiency and durability of modern products and infrastructure.

key_trends: Low product differentiation translates into heavy internal competition. Adhesive manufacturers must constantly improve the quality and uniqueness of their products to gain a competitive advantage.

Imported adhesives pose a limited threat to domestic manufacturers. Many consumers and markets prefer high-quality domestic products and are willing to pay more. Tariffs also help limit competition from foreign adhesives.
Many companies will target specialized markets, creating diversity among manufacturers. Larger companies will often acquire these niche manufacturers to expand their product offerings.
Anticipated economic rebound will fuel growth. Projected Federal Reserve interest rate cuts starting in 2024 are expected to boost demand for adhesives beginning in 2025.

Rising exports will support growth, particularly since the US dollar is expected to depreciate in value. The USMCA trade agreement – coupled with relatively lower prices – will drive foreign buyers to up their purchases.

The four largest companies account for nearly one-quarter of adhesive manufacturing revenue. These companies benefit from offering a wide portfolio of adhesives to different markets and having an established reputation, whereas smaller companies typically compete within a smaller niche.

Successful companies are innovating and introducing high-quality, versatile products. Some innovations associated with adhesives include eco-friendly formulations, self-healing properties and improved bonding through nanotechnology.

Used for various construction tasks like sealing cracks, roofing and weatherproofing. Also includes paint tapes and adhesive strips.
Adhesives manufactured from renewable sources like plant-based materials and animal glues, utilizing inputs such as cellulose, starch and gelatin.
Provide both bonding and sealing functions for building components, ensuring structural stability while preventing moisture infiltration and air leakage. Offer enhanced thermal insulation properties.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: When the value of residential construction increases, indicating a rise in housing starts and new building projects, there is a corresponding surge in the demand for adhesives.
Adhesives are essential components in manufacturing processes across various industries, including automotive, aerospace, electronics, packaging and construction.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Imports have continued to expand as a share of domestic demand
international_trade_points.trade_description: The trade-weighted index, which measures the strength of the US dollar, increased significantly over the last few years – enabling relatively inexpensive purchases of foreign-produced adhesives.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Consistent with exports trends, imports from Canada and Mexico have been growing
international_trade_points.trade_description: Canada has historically accounted for a substantial portion of domestic imports of adhesives, which is attributed to strong trade relations between the US and Canada. Adhesive imports from Canada have increased in recent years, propelled by factors such as the USMCA agreement and the appreciating US dollar.

international_trade_points.trade_title: The decline in exports has been driven by a combination of macroeconomic and geopolitical factors
international_trade_points.trade_description: A decline over the past few years in the export of adhesives to China – the third-largest foreign market in this industry – has been linked to continued trade tensions between the US and China.

international_trade_points.trade_title: The United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) contributed to higher exports within North America
international_trade_points.trade_description: Due to the USMCA – which replaced NAFTA in 2020 – and their proximity to domestic manufacturers, Canada and Mexico are the two biggest destinations for US exports.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The CAA is a federal law aimed directly at controlling the number of pollutants that are released into the atmosphere, and is enforced by the Environmental Protection Agency. The CAA particularly impacts the Adhesive Manufacturing industry because it deals with National Emission Standards for Hazardous Air Pollutants (NESHAP) and volatile organic compounds (VOCs). During the manufacturing process of adhesives, if HAPs and VOCs are released into the environment, manufacturers risk punishments ranging from fines to criminal charges.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Regulations
regulations_points.regulation_description: Since the industry works with potentially dangerous chemical compounds, manufacturers must adhere to a standard of health and safety in the workplace as set out in Title 29 of the Code of Federal Relations. Adhesive manufacturing companies are also responsible for adhering to various state and local regulations regarding labor and emissions.

Adhesives used for food packaging must follow FDA regulations to ensure food safety. These regulations seek to ensure that chemicals from the adhesives don't seep into food products. Adhesives must also maintain specific temperature thresholds.

The Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive took effect on January 5, 2023, enhancing reporting standards for social and environmental data. It expands reporting obligations to more large companies and listed small and medium enterprises. Additionally, non-EU companies with more than EUR 150 million market presence in the EU are required to report sustainability information.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Adhesive manufacturing is subject to regulatory requirements related to product safety, environmental protection, and workplace safety. Complying with these regulations requires time, resources, and expertise, posing a barrier to entry for new firms, especially those lacking regulatory knowledge and experience.
Existing adhesive manufacturers may have built strong brand loyalty and long-term relationships with customers through consistent product quality.
Overcoming brand loyalty and establishing trust with customers can be challenging for new entrants.

Adhesive manufacturing requires specialized technology, equipment, and expertise. New entrants may face technological barriers in acquiring or developing the necessary technology and expertise to compete effectively with established manufacturers.
Finding skilled labor that can produce adhesives that comply with quality and safety regulations is difficult. Even so, wages remain consistent with the rest of the manufacturing sector.

Establishing a manufacturing facility for adhesives requires significant capital investment in equipment, technology, research and development, and production facilities. This high upfront investment can deter new entrants, especially smaller firms or startups, from entering the market.

basis_points.basis_title: Low product differentiation translates into heavy internal competition.
basis_points.basis_description: Adhesive manufacturers must constantly improve the quality and uniqueness of their products to gain a competitive advantage.

basis_points.basis_title: Many companies will target specialized markets, creating diversity among manufacturers.
basis_points.basis_description: Larger companies will often acquire these niche manufacturers to expand their product offerings.

concentration_points.concentration_title: PRODUCT DIVERSITY CREATES SPACE FOR OTHERS TO GROW
concentration_points.concentration_description: Many adhesive manufacturers operate in niche segments, preventing a few companies from dominating the entire industry. Each segment requires specialized equipment, personnel and inputs.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases make up the largest expense for manufacturers.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases include plastic materials and resins, synthetic rubber, inorganic chemicals and compounds, refined petroleum products and plastic and metal containers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Changes in the price of crude oil directly influence purchasing expenses.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Some companies have prioritized natural adhesives given high plastic and resin prices. The Russian invasion of Ukraine has added to supply chain volatility, given Russia's participation in OPEC+.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Larger companies often enter contracts with suppliers to lock in low rates and protect themselves from volatility.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Such companies typically have stronger reputations that enable them to pass down price hikes to consumers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Profit declined during the pandemic as many markets relevant to this industry halted business.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Fluctuating input prices and rising interest rates have limited demand from downstream markets, stifling profit recovery.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Larger companies have had more success passing added costs down to consumers, leading to notable profit stratification.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: These companies also take advantage of long-term contracts and economies of scale to produce lower-cost products.
Despite hefty capital expenses and automation efforts, manufacturers still need highly skilled workers for research and development teams.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Manufacturing plants also need skilled engineers to keep production safe, efficient and compliant with regulations.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Quality control is also essential given the industry's highly precise downstream markets.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Finding skilled labor that can produce adhesives that comply with quality and safety regulations is difficult. Even so, wages remain consistent with the rest of the manufacturing sector.
Establishing a manufacturing facility for adhesives requires significant capital investment in equipment, technology, research and development, and production facilities.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Changes in Raw Material Prices Affect the Prices for Adhesives
volatility_points.volatility_description: Adhesives can be formulated from a wide range of raw materials and chemicals – including resins, solvents and additives – which are often affected by factors other than inflation.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Demand for Adhesives May Fluctuate Depending on Macroeconomic Conditions
volatility_points.volatility_description: During periods of economic expansion (such as those marked by low unemployment and rising consumer confidence), demand for adhesives used in construction, manufacturing and consumer products may increase.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Demand for adhesives is closely tied to construction activity.
volatility_points.volatility_description: High levels of construction – such as new residential, commercial or infrastructure projects – typically lead to increased need for adhesives used in building materials.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Fluctuations in global trade and supply chains can affect adhesive demand.
volatility_points.volatility_description: Changes in tariffs or trade agreements and disruptions in supply chains may impact the availability and cost of raw materials used in adhesive production.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: New Product Developments are Focused on Increasing the Sustainability of End Products
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: With consumers increasingly prioritizing eco-conscious choices, new product initiatives aim to meet new standards, fostering sustainable practices and transparency.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Water-based adhesives have gained popularity due to their lower environmental impact compared with solvent-based alternatives.
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Water-based formulas emit fewer volatile organic compounds and exhibit reduced toxicity, contributing to improved indoor air quality and environmental health.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Manufacturers are developing adhesives derived from renewable resources such as plant-based materials or agricultural waste.
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: These bio-based adhesives offer a sustainable alternative to traditional petroleum-based adhesives.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a niche, or do you produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Amid the consolidatory climate, companies entering the industry tend to produce specialized or niche products to attract customers.

FAQs.question: Have exports offered an opportunity for your company?
FAQs.answer: Exports have not accounted for a large share of industry revenue but are expected to increase as a share moving forward. Canada and Mexico account for nearly half of industry exports and demand from the two countries is expected to continue to grow under the USMCA.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices in recent years?
FAQs.answer: Since the price of the industry's key inputs is largely correlated with oil, it tends to be somewhat volatile.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing heavily in R&D to meet changing consumer preferences?
FAQs.answer: Investment in research and development is necessary for product innovation, as it expands the uses of adhesive products and increases their demand.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation in recent years?
FAQs.answer: The industry requires highly skilled laborers for R&D and to keep production efficient, safe and on schedule.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: The industry benefits from trade groups that work to improve the industry's operating environment and the position of its member companies.
